p: Archival human sera were obtained from the National Institutes of Health-National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke (NIH-NINDS) Serum Archive of Binghamton University, New York, USA. Samples were collected in New Guinea (now known as PNG) from East Sepik (1959); Chimbu (1962); and Eastern Highlands (1962) including villages in the hinterlands of present-day Morobe Province ( Table 1). Additional samples were collected in Dutch New Guinea (now known as West Papua) in 1962–1963, from the northeast coast Central Highlands and southern coast ( Table 2). The samples were stored at –20°C or -80°C at the NIH and Binghamton University prior to analysis.
